        • pycheron.util.format

    pycheron.util.format¶

    format_mseed_filenames(data_dir, new_data_dir)[source]¶

    This function takes in a data directory path with mseed files and reads in each file to reformat each stream into the correct format callPycheronMetric needs. (i.e. each filename is “<station>_<channel>_<julian day>.mseed”). Then outputs them to a new data folder.

    Parameters:
    • data_dir (str) – Path to the current data directory contain all the mseed files
    • new_data_dir (str) – Name of directory to save newly formatted files.

    Example

    1. Example 1: Combined Channels and Days

      This example shows how to use this function on a folder containing mseed files with combined channels/dates.

      Current Folder Structure

      # data folder containing a singular mseed file or a singular station
data_dir
    ANMO_All_chans_3_days.mseed

      New Folder Structure

      new_data_dir
     ANMO_EHE_001.mseed
     ANMO_EHN_001.mseed
     ANMO_EHZ_001.mseed
     ANMO_EHE_002.mseed
     ANMO_EHN_002.mseed
     ANMO_EHZ_002.mseed
     ANMO_EHE_003.mseed
     ANMO_EHN_003.mseed
     ANMO_EHZ_003.mseed

    2. Example 2: Nested Folder

      This example shows how to use this function on a nested folder.

      Current Folder Structure

      # datafolder containing station folders
data_dir
     # Station folder containing individual channel folders with individual day .mseed files
     BGU
         EHE
             day1.mseed
             day2.mseed
         EHN
             day1.mseed
             day2.mseed
         EHZ
             day1.mseed
             day2.mseed
     # Station folder containing individual channels, but combined days
     JPU
         BHN_all_days.mseed
         BHE_all_days.mseed
         BHZ_all_days.mseed
     # Station folders containing individual days, but combined channels
     TCRU
         EH*_day1.mseed
         EH*_day2.mseed

      New Folder Structure

      new_data_dir
     BGU_EHE_001.mseed
     BGU_EHN_001.mseed
     BGU_EHZ_001.mseed
     BGU_EHE_002.mseed
     BGU_EHN_002.mseed
     BGU_EHZ_002.mseed
     JPU_EHE_001.mseed
     JPU_EHN_001.mseed
     JPU_EHZ_001.mseed
     JPU_EHE_002.mseed
     JPU_EHN_002.mseed
     JPU_EHZ_002.mseed
     TCRU_EHE_001.mseed
     TCRU_EHN_001.mseed
     TCRU_EHZ_001.mseed
     TCRU_EHE_002.mseed
     TCRU_EHN_002.mseed
     TCRU_EHZ_002.mseed
    parse_snclq(snclq, comb=False)[source]¶

    This function takes a sncql string and parses it into individual variables.

    Parameters:
    • sncql – Formatted ex. IU.ANMO.00.BHZ.M
    • comb (bool) – If inputing 2 snclqs from correlation metrics formatted ex. SNCLQ1:SNCLQ2
    Returns:

    network, station, channel, location, quality. If comb=True, will return 2 formatted SNCLQs to be run again individually.
    Return type:

    str, str, str, str, str

    Example

    1. Individual SNCLQ
    from pycheron.util.format import parse_snclq
snclq = "7A.CABN..BHE"
network, station, channel, location, quality = parse_snclq(snclq)
    1. Combined SNCLQ
    from pycheron.util.format import parse_snclq
snclq_comb = "7A.CABN..BHE:7A.CABN..BHN"
snclq1, snclq2 = parse_snclq(snclq_comb)
network1, station1, channel1, location1, quality1 = parse_snclq(snclq1)
network2, station2, channel2, location2, quality2 = parse_snclq(snclq2)
